Package task1

Class OperateArrays

java.lang.Object
task1.OperateArrays
class OperateArrays extends Object
The OperateArrays class performs some operations on a two-dimensional array of integers and an array of strings.

It provides a traditional approach that uses loops and individual elements and a functional approach that uses functions of the Arrays class (without loops).

  • Field Summary

    Field

    usingTraditionalApproach(int[][] intArray, boolean fillWithMultiChars)

    private static void
    verifyIntArray(int[][] intArray, boolean isTraditionalApproach)
    Verifies the given two-dimensional array of integers for compliance with the following requirements: The number of all rows of the given array must be equal to 5. The number of all columns must be equal to 3. The array must be filled with random positive odd integers from 3 to 31. If any of the requirements are not met, an error message is printed and the program is closed.

      Finds the minimum value in the provided row of an array of integers.

      Returns:

    • fillStringArray

      private static void fillStringArray(String[] stringArray, int[][] intArray, boolean fillWithMultiChars)
      Fills the provided array of strings with items consisting of the 'N' character or multiple characters from the 'CHARACTERS' array according to fillWithMultiChars flag based on the minimum value in each row of the array of integers.
      Parameters:
      stringArray - array of strings;
      intArray - two-dimensional array of integers;
      fillWithMultiChars - flag to check which characters to fill the strings in the array of strings with.

    • sortStringArrayByReverseAlphabet

      private static void sortStringArrayByReverseAlphabet(String[] stringArray)
      Sorts the provided array of strings in reverse alphabetical order using bubble sort.
      Parameters:
      stringArray - array of strings.

    • printStringArray

      private static void printStringArray(String[] stringArray)
      Prints the provided array of strings to the console.
      Parameters:
      stringArray - array of strings.

    • verifyIntArray

      private static void verifyIntArray(int[][] intArray, boolean isTraditionalApproach)
      Verifies the given two-dimensional array of integers for compliance with the following requirements:
      • The number of all rows of the given array must be equal to 5.
      • The number of all columns must be equal to 3.
      • The array must be filled with random positive odd integers from 3 to 31.
      • If any of the requirements are not met, an error message is printed and the program is closed.
      Parameters:
      intArray - two-dimensional array of integers;
      isTraditionalApproach - flag to check which approach should be used for verification.

    • usingTraditionalApproach

      static void usingTraditionalApproach()
      Operates on arrays using the traditional approach.

      Creates the two-dimensional array of integers and fills it with random positive odd numbers. Prints the array of integers. Fills the array of strings with 'N' character based on the minimum value in each row of the array of integers. Prints the array of strings. Sorts the array of strings in reverse alphabetical order and prints it.

    • usingTraditionalApproach

      static void usingTraditionalApproach(int[][] intArray, boolean fillWithMultiChars)
      Operates on arrays using the traditional approach and using the test array of integers and filling the array of strings with multiple characters or specified character.

      Verifies and prints the array of integers. Fills the array of strings with the 'N' character or multiple characters from the 'CHARACTERS' array according to fillWithMultiChars flag based on the minimum value in each row of the array of integers. Prints the array of strings. Sorts the array of strings in reverse alphabetical order and prints it.

      Parameters:
      intArray - two-dimensional array of integers;
      fillWithMultiChars - flag to check which characters to fill the strings in the array of strings with.

    • usingFunctionalApproach

      static void usingFunctionalApproach()
      Operates on arrays using the functional approach.

      Creates the two-dimensional array of integers and fills it with random positive odd numbers. Prints the array of integers. Fills the array of strings with 'N' character based on the minimum value in each row of the array of integers. Prints the array of strings. Sorts the array of strings in reverse alphabetical order and prints it.

    • usingFunctionalApproach

      static void usingFunctionalApproach(int[][] intArray, boolean fillWithMultiChars)
      Operates on arrays using the functional approach and using the test array of integers and filling the array of strings with multiple characters or specified character.

      Verifies and prints the array of integers. Fills the array of strings with the 'N' character or multiple characters from the 'CHARACTERS' array according to fillWithMultiChars flag based on the minimum value in each row of the array of integers. Prints the array of strings. Sorts the array of strings in reverse alphabetical order and prints it.

      Parameters:
      intArray - two-dimensional array of integers;
      fillWithMultiChars - flag to check which characters to fill the strings in the array of strings with.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Calls static methods of the OperateArrays class demonstrating the traditional and functional approaches with different test data. The args are not used.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments.
